main event: A civilian observed a bright, unusual light in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on multiple occasions between March 8 and March 31, 1966.
interesting points: The light appeared brighter than Venus and fluctuated in intensity,Witnesses compared the light to a star or an airplane but noted it moved faster than a satellite,One report described the object as looking like a parachute,No physical evidence was found to substantiate the claims,Other observers in the area reported similar sightings around the same time.
witness description: Civilians observed the light intermittently over the course of several days.
